initial_question.title: How to use my own caption files, like .txt file when training
initial_question.body: How to use my own caption files, instead of using default

satisfaction_conditions: Caption files must be accessible to the training system
Caption files must be correctly associated with their corresponding images
Custom caption files must be in a text-based format
Caption data must be recognized instead of default captions

initial_question.title: question about image caption file types
initial_question.body:
Hello,

I was looking at the args.json file for some comparison and troubleshooting and saw this line:
 
 _"caption_extension": ".caption",_

In my dataset, my images are tagged with a identically named _.txt_ . Does this line mean that I have inadvertently been training without image captions at all?

If so, how should I address this problem? Change my picture captions to _.caption_ or is there a setting that I need to change?

Thanks

satisfaction_conditions: Image captions are successfully loaded and processed regardless of file extension
System provides clear feedback about caption file loading
Caption file extension configuration is properly recognized by the system

initial_question.title: How to train more optimization steps?
initial_question.body:
Hi,

I had a quick question, I noticed that changing the number of repeats, or number of datasets the overall optimization steps appears to remain the same (3000). 

If I wanted to train a lora for longer (more overall optimization steps), what would be the best way to go about it?

satisfaction_conditions: Training duration can be extended beyond the default 3000 steps
Training step count can be controlled independently of dataset size and repeat settings
